definitions.definition: a cloth bag filled with soft material or feathers that is used, for example, to make a seat more comfortable

examples.text: a floor cushion *(= a large  that you put on the floor to sit on)*
a cushion of moss on a rock
I rested my elbow on a cushion.
She plumped up the sofa cushions before the guests arrived.

definitions.definition: a layer of something between two surfaces that keeps them apart

examples.text: A hovercraft rides on a cushion of air.
Underlay forms a cushion between the carpet and the floor, to minimize wear.

definitions.definition: something that protects you against something unpleasant that might happen

examples.text: His savings were a comfortable cushion against financial problems.
The team built up a safe cushion of two goals in the first half.

definitions.definition: the soft inside edge along each side of the table that the balls bounce off

wordOrigin: Middle English: from Old French cuissin, based on a Latin word meaning ‘cushion for the hip’, from coxa ‘hip, thigh’. The Romans also had a word cubital ‘elbow cushion’, from cubitus ‘elbow’.
